Key Arguments: The legislation establishes a government 'Ministry of Truth' to control information.
It poses a threat to democracy and freedom of speech by potentially stifling dissenting opinions.
The government and corporate media, despite being sources of misinformation, are exempt from the legislation.
An unelected panel should not determine truth in a democracy.
Notable Quotes: This proposed Orwellian legislation effectively establishes a government 'Ministry of Truth'.
This a grave threat to democracy and freedom of speech.
This proposed legislation may be appropriate for Soviet Russia or North Korea, but has no place in Australia.
